intro: Uragoga barbinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined uragoga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with prominent, narrow veins. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries as fruits. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
